messages.content:
You are a Google Drive data generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to generate realistic Drive file data based on scenario information.

The output must be valid JSON matching the Drive schema with:
- files: array of {id, name, mimeType (optional), content (optional text excerpt), modifiedTime (optional)}

Generate Drive files that reflect:
- Events from sub_scenarios_expanded (core scenario events, e.g., documents, reports)
- Events from noise_scenarios (unrelated workplace files)
- Respect noise_level: 0 = minimal noise, 1 = lots of unrelated files
- Respect depth: 0 = direct/obvious files, 1 = indirect/multi-step file references

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:
{
  "files": [
    {
      "id": "WEB-planning-agenda-2025-11-17",
      "name": "WEB Planning Meetings Agenda - 2025-11-17",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-14T10:30:00+09:00",
      "content": "Website Redesign (WEB) – Planning Sessions
Date: Monday, 17 Nov 2025
Location: Zoom

Block: 10:00–11:00 JST (back-to-back meetings)

Meeting 1 – WEB Planning: Scope & Priorities
Time: 10:00–10:30 JST
Participants: Alex (PM), Jordan (Engineer)
Objectives:
- Align on project scope for the Website Redesign (WEB)
- Confirm priorities for initial milestones
- Validate assumptions behind WEB-100 and WEB-101
Agenda:
1. Quick recap of WEB project goals (5 min)
2. Review current Jira tickets (WEB-100, WEB-101) (10 min)
3. Define scope for the first release (10 min)
4. Next steps and owners (5 min)

Meeting 2 – WEB Planning: Technical Approach
Time: 10:30–11:00 JST (immediately after Meeting 1)
Participants: Sam (Senior Engineer), Taylor (Lead Engineer)
Objectives:
- Review proposed technical architecture for the Website Redesign
- Identify risks and dependencies
- Estimate effort and align on Development/Launch milestones
Agenda:
1. Walkthrough of current architecture constraints (5 min)
2. Proposed redesign approach (15 min)
3. Estimates & risks for Development (20 Nov) and Launch (30 Nov) milestones (5 min)
4. Assign follow-up tasks and documentation (5 min)"
    },
    {
      "id": "WEB-meeting-notes-scope-priorities-2025-11-17",
      "name": "WEB Planning: Scope & Priorities - Meeting Notes",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-17T10:35:00+09:00",
      "content": "WEB Planning: Scope & Priorities – Meeting Notes
Meeting ID: WEB-planning-1
Date: 17 Nov 2025
Time: 10:00–10:30 JST
Location: Zoom (https://zoom.example.com/j/1234567890)
Participants: Alex (PM), Jordan (Engineer)

1. Project recap
- Goal: Full Website Redesign (WEB) to improve UX and performance before 30 Nov 2025.
- Related Jira issues: WEB-100 (Initial Setup – Done), WEB-101 (Core Feature – In Progress).

2. Scope decisions
- MVP scope finalized for initial launch before 30 Nov milestone.
- Priorities:
  1) Core navigation redesign
  2) Responsive layout improvements
  3) Page speed optimization for top 3 landing pages
- Out of scope for this phase:
  - Blog archive redesign
  - Legacy admin tools refactor

3. Milestones alignment
- Planning completed by 17 Nov (this meeting).
- Development to begin 20 Nov as per roadmap.
- Launch target remains 30 Nov, pending estimates from technical session with Sam & Taylor at 10:30–11:00 (WEB Planning: Technical Approach).

4. Action items
- Alex: Update WEB project roadmap doc with agreed scope by EOD 17 Nov.
- Jordan: Prepare detailed requirements for WEB-101 and create follow-up Jira tickets for sub-tasks.

Note: This meeting is the first of two consecutive WEB planning sessions; the second is the "WEB Planning: Technical Approach" meeting with Sam and Taylor immediately afterward."
    },
    {
      "id": "WEB-meeting-notes-technical-approach-2025-11-17",
      "name": "WEB Planning: Technical Approach - Meeting Notes",
      "mimeType": "application/vnd.google-apps.document",
      "modifiedTime": "2025-11-17T11:05:00+09:00",
      "content": "WEB Planning: Technical Approach – Meeting Notes
Meeting ID: WEB-planning-2
Date: 17 Nov 2025
Time: 10:30–11:00 JST
Location: Zoom (https://zoom.example.com/j/0987654321)
Participants: Sam (Senior Engineer), Taylor (Lead Engineer)

1. Context
- Second of two consecutive Website Redesign (WEB) planning meetings.
- Follows the 10:00–10:30 "WEB Planning: Scope & Priorities" session with Alex & Jordan.
- Scope and priorities confirmed there are assumed as input here.

2. Proposed technical approach
- Frontend framework: continue with React, upgrade to latest minor version.
- Styling: migrate to design system components for main navigation and landing pages.
- Performance: enable code splitting and image optimization for top 3 landing pages.

3. Dependencies & risks
- Dependency on design team to finalize navigation redesign by 19 Nov.
- Risk: tight timeline between Development start (20 Nov) and Launch (30 Nov).
- Mitigation: phase the rollout, starting with homepage and primary landing page.

4. Estimates and alignment with milestones
- Development (20–28 Nov): feasible with current staffing for MVP scope.
- Buffer for QA and fixes: 29 Nov.
- Launch: 30 Nov still achievable if scope creep is controlled.

5. Action items
- Sam: Break down technical tasks into sub-tasks under WEB-101 and create additional Jira issues as needed.
- Taylor: Document final technical approach in the WEB Architecture Overview and share with Alex and Jordan.

Note: This meeting is explicitly scheduled back-to-back with the earlier WEB planning session to maintain continuity between scope decisions and technical planning."
    }
  ]
}
